page.title: 09The Community Centre.
page.content: {The Community Centre,}originally a{National School,}was built in 1835. The school had served all age groups. In 1946 it became a{County {School.}It finally closed when the new{County Junior and Infant Schools in Pennys Lane were opened in 1974. It had long been hoped to have a {Community Association}in the town, so a steering committee was formed and {Avonway}came into being. In time it became the home of many of the town's established clubs such as the Camera Club, Women's Institute etc. In time, many new clubs were formed such as Keep Fit, Yoga, Bridge and Skittles. Avonway also houses a play-group for the under-fives and adult education classes.{The Avonford Youth Club}is run by voluntary staff for children from 7 to 14 years of age.{The County runs a{Youth Club}for those over 14.
